dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Anything I can do to help you out?

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yeah, plenty. If you're the type to fix a thing or two, I've got a couple reports I need to follow up on.

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: The pipes up on Milton's house burst. Someone needs to shut 'em off. Then there are the cables outside the bar - a sprat chewed through 'em and now they're spitting lightning.

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Then there's the old guard house - outside town, on the way to the old Bayside Terrace. Someone needs to reset the comms breaker there.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Simple enough. I'll let you know when they're done.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wow. Things are really falling apart around here.

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: I oughta tell you - most of these systems are routed through one of our terminals. You might be able to handle some of 'em remotely if you know your way around a computer.

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: We sent Milton out to check on the comms tower a while ago. Ain't heard back. I'd wager he got ate.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Great. I'll keep an eye out.

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Up the hill. It's right on the cliff's edge.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: All right. I'll let you know if I "get ate."

dialog.speaker: Bronson (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's one way to look at it. Another is: Those are the only things in this whole fucking town that are broke. Maybe we appreciate that.
